snippet: More than 380,000 Americans filed for jobless benefits last week. Economists had expected a decline to 355,000.
abstract: Labor Department says that the number of Americans filing for jobless benefits hit a two-month high; initial claims for state unemployment benefits increased by 13,000, to a seasonally adjusted 380,000, defying economists’ expectations for a drop to 355,000; the previous week’s count was revised to show 10,000 more applications than previously reported.
lead_paragraph: More than 380,000 Americans filed for jobless benefits last week. Economists had expected a decline to 355,000.

headline.seo: Jobless Claims Rise as Trade Gap Shrinks
headline.main: Jobless Claims Rise as Nation’s Trade Gap Shrinks
headline.print_headline: Jobless Claims Rise as Nation’s Trade Gap Shrinks
